articles.title: Albanian President on Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK
Korean People's Cause of Reunification Supported by Brazil
articles.content:
Albanian President on Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Albanian President Alfred Moisiu received credentials from the DPRK ambassador e.p. to Albania on Nov. 23.
 Expressing the hope that the friendly and cooperative relations between Albania and the DPRK would grow stronger, the president said: I favor the Korean people's efforts to independently solve all the issues related to the reunification of their country on their own. Availing myself of this opportunity, I would like to offer sincerest congratulations to His Excellency Kim Jong Il on his great success and best wishes to him.

articles.title: National Meeting to Mark 60th Anniversary of GFTUK
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause of Reunification Supported by Brazil 
    Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Brazil supports the Korean people's efforts to achieve the peaceful reunification of their country on the principle of national independence free from outside interference in the spirit of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration. 
 Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula Da Silva said this when receiving credentials from the DPRK ambassador e. p. to Brazil on Nov. 24. 
 The president said Brazil is paying deep attention to the Korean people's struggle for defending socialism and building a great prosperous powerful nation under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.    
 Noting that Brazil attaches importance to the development of its relations with the DPRK, he stressed that it would make efforts to expand and develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in all fields including politics, economy and culture in the future.

articles.content:
Koreans Can Never Escape Misfortune under U.S. Military Occupation 
    Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists' policy of occupation of south Korea is the root cause of all sorts of misfortune and sufferings the Koreans have undergone due to the national division. 
 It was the United States that divided the homogeneous Korean nation that lived in one and the same territory throughout its history spanning 5,000 years. And it is due to its policy of occupation of south Korea that Korea still remains divided and its people have undergone misfortune and sufferings for the last 60 years. Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes this in a signed article. It goes on:    
 The south Korean people can never escape death and misfortune as long as the U.S. imperialist aggression forces are present in south Korea. 
 It is quite natural for the south Koreans to demand the pullback of the U.S. forces from south Korea, terming them the largest gang of man-killers. 
 The Koreans' desire for putting an end to the national division and establishing a unified state has not come true due to the U.S. imperialists' hideous and persistent moves to block it.  The U.S. imperialists leave no means untried to quell the growing desire of the Koreans in the north and the south for independent reunification.    
 The south Koreans and all other Koreans should force the U.S. imperialist aggression forces to pull out of south Korea. This is the only way of putting an end to the history of distress and realizing their aspiration after independence, democracy, peace and reunification.  The south Koreans should wage a staunch struggle against the U.S. imperialists, cruel murderers, the worst human rights abusers, aggressors and plunderers, and settle accounts with them and thereby demonstrate the mettle of the Korean nation and make a positive contribution to the independent reunification of the country.

articles.title: National Symposium on Kyongrak Held
U.S. Aerial Espionage against DPRK in November under Fire
articles.content:
National Symposium on Kyongrak Held
    Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The first national scientific symposium on Kyongrak took place at the Academy of Koryo Medical Science from Nov. 29 through 30 under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the Korean General Federation of Science and Technology.
 Research on Kyongrak, one of important issues in developing Koryo medical science, advantageous traditional medical science of the Korean nation, is brisk in different parts of the country in recent years in response to the Workers' Party of Korea's idea of attaching importance to science and its public health policy.
 More than 50 treatises were presented to the symposium which was attended by researchers, doctors and teachers from scientific and research institutes, educational institutions and public health organs in different parts of the country including the Academy of Koryo Medical Science, Pyongyang University of Medicine, Kang Kon Sariwon University of Medicine and Phyongsong University of Medicine. 
 The speakers referred to various scientific achievements made in the drive to give a scientific exposition of the theory of Kyongrak and apply it to clinical practices.    
 Those treatises conducive to formulating the Juche-oriented theory of Kyongrak on a scientific basis were highly estimated at the symposium.
 Diplomas and prizes were awarded to those who presented valuable papers at a closing ceremony.    .

articles.title: Greetings to Lao President
Greetings to Romanian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Lao President
    Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Khamtay Siphandone, president of Laos, on the occasion of the 30th founding anniversary of the People's Democratic Republic of Laos.
 The message noted that the Korean people are sincerely rejoiced over the great successes made by the Lao government and people in national defense and economic construction through their dynamic efforts to carry out the decisions of the 7th Congress of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party under the leadership of the party headed by the president. 
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in conformity with  the desire and in the interests of the two peoples in the future, too, the message wholeheartedly wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the development of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Romanian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Romanian President
    Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Romanian President Traian Basescu on Dec. 1 on the occasion of its national day.
 The message extended sincere congratulations to the president and wished the Romanian people prosperity and wellbeing.

articles.title: Greetings to Lao Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Romanian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greetings to Calin Popescu-Taricheanu, prime minister of Romania, on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wished him success in his work for the stability and development of the country.

articles.title: Historical Relics Restored in DPRK
articles.content:
Greetings to Lao Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to his Lao counterpart Bounnhang Vorachith on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the People's Democratic Republic of Laos.
 The message sincerely wished him greater success in his responsible work, expressing the belief that the traditional ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples.    
 Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to Somsavath Lengsavath, vice-prime minister and concurrently foreign minister of Laos.
